alert.note: Alert for Fairfield; Kershaw; Lexington; Richland; Southern Lancaster (South Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 23 at 12:29PM EDT by NWS Columbia
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of eastern Fairfield, southwestern Lancaster, northeastern Lexington, northeastern Richland and southwestern Kershaw Counties through 100 PM EDT... At 1229 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Columbia International University, or near St. Andrews, moving northeast at 40 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Columbia, West Columbia, Cayce, Irmo, Forest Acres, Winnsboro, Springdale, St. Andrews, Dentsville, Oak Grove, South Congaree, Pine Ridge, Arcadia Lakes, Columbia International University, Liberty Hill, Harbison State Forest, Sesquicentennial State Park, Lake Carolina, SC State Fair Grounds and West Columbia Riverwalk. This includes the following highways... Interstate 126 between mile markers 0 and 3. Interstate 20 in South Carolina between mile markers 60 and 86. Interstate 26 between mile markers 102 and 120. Interstate 77 between mile markers 0 and 48. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.

area.areaDesc: Fairfield; Kershaw; Lexington; Richland; Southern Lancaster
